Posts.Content: mandih wrote: Hi- I am brand new to this site but thankful to have found it. Earlier this week I found a lump in my left breast. I am very religious about self exams and any changes in my body for that matter. Previous to this I had noticed my right breast was noticeably larger than the other and mentioned this to my OBGYN at my yearly appointment in Feb. She said it’s normal and not concerned. She also said my breasts are lumpy. I’m 33 So fast forward to this week. I notice the lump in the left breast, see my PCP 2 days later, she feels the lump and writes an order for mammogram and ultrasound and does a referral to a surgeon just in case. I was able to get in the same day, thankfully. I hate waiting. The left breast came back normal but there were 2 suspicious spots on right. I was surprised. They went ahead and ordered an US of the right breast and also did the ultrasound of the palpable area on the left. The ultrasoun matched the mammogram. As of now it says birads 3- probably benign. I see the surgeon this upcoming Wednesday. Does anyone have a similar experience like this? If so what happened? I have the disc of images from the mammogram and ultrasound and have compared them on google. One looks possibly like a cyst and the other a fibeoadenoma. This could explain the larger breast size on the right which steadily gets larger. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Happening so fast mandih mandih

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2018 01:09PM mandih wrote: I will! I know many health care professionals discourage patients “googling” but in my history it’s worked out. I accurately diagnosed a brain tumor a couple of years ago- I had a good idea based on my symptoms but once I received the scans, I was sure. So by the time I had a consult with the neurosurgeon, I knew exactly what it was and which surgery I wanted. Googling has helped me advocate for myself. I definitely hope what I’ve seen in this instance is correct but I am also worried that it’s more
Posts.Title: Happening so fast mandih mandih

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2018 09:15AM mandih wrote: Djmammo- I have my full radiology report- if I type it up, will you interpret it? I have a consult with a surgeon this week and I'm trying to decide if I should request an MRI or just go straight for a biopsy.
Posts.Title: Happening so fast mandih mandih

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2018 04:41PM - edited Sep 26, 2018 04:42PM by mandih I am scheduled for a biopsy next Wednesday. She will biopsy all the masses in my right breast as well as one in my left. It was not picked up on the mammogram and I'm fairly certain the ultrasound tech didn't check that spot as she only checked where the little sticker was The surgeon says they look benign, a cyst and fibroadenomas. I'm hoping the biopsies confirm this.
Posts.Title: Happening so fast mandih mandih

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2018 10:07AM - edited Oct 15, 2018 10:08AM by mandih I got my pathology report today- 1 mass is a fibroadenoma and the others are cysts! I am definitely relieved to receive this report. I have a follow up in 6 months. I do have 1 question if anyone can answer it- I will also send a message to the doctor it. One of the specimens on the report says "adequate for evaluation but limited by scant cellularity" Is that ok? Should I follow up on that or just wait the 6 months? There are also other words in the descriptions that I don't understand but the dr didn't seem concerned.
Posts.Title: Happening so fast mandih mandih

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2018 10:51AM mandih wrote: Hi Shonna71-47 I would be very nervous as well! I have 4 lumps that will be biopsied next week- a fine needle biopsy. One is a cyst and the surgeon things fibroadenoma for the others. Hopefully the biopsy will confirm that. Did you have a biopsy to confirm fibroadenoma when it was first found?
